basics.name: Nathan Storey
basics.label: Director of Data Governance
basics.summary: Data governance and digital services leader committed to making government work better for all New Yorkers, with 10+ years in NYC government. Built the City's first standardized open dataset of NYC agencies, now powering the NYC.gov Agency Directory. At the Department of Homeless Services, delivered street homelessness products (HOME-STAT, StreetSmart) and drove racial equity analysis that secured hundreds of housing placements.

work.name: NYC Office of Technology & Innovation (OTI) - Office of Data & Analytics (ODA)
highlights: Delivered NYC Agency and Governance Organizations (303 entities), the City's first open, standardized agency reference, democratizing access to government structure by consolidating 8 fragmented lists into a public resource now powering the NYC.gov Agency Directory.
Co-led MetaCat development: internal metadata catalog improving discoverability and usability of non-public datasets, with 325+ data assets from 21 agencies.
Trained 400+ city staff across 15 agencies on WorkerConnect, NYC's cross-agency data-sharing platform enabling caseworkers to better serve vulnerable New Yorkers.
Built open-source tools enabling LLMs to query NYC Open Data APIs; delivered 4 presentations on responsible AI use for government data through the Open Data Ambassador program.
Drove data standards working groups including the Data Asset Working Group; created internal collaboration website (nycdata.nycnet) consolidating 35 resources for the initiative.

work.name: NYC Department of Homeless Services
work.position: Executive Director of Data & Analytics; Founding Director, Street Homeless Solutions Lab
highlights: Founded Street Homeless Solutions Lab, a 3-person product and service design team; secured funding and executive sponsorship to center user needs in technology decisions.

Designed and implemented participatory policy co-creation using Polis and vTaiwan-inspired methods, engaging 300 frontline and executive staff across 17 programs in consensus-driven practice redesign - among the first vTaiwan-inspired processes in U.S. city government.

Directed cross-system data integration for street homeless clients, including racial equity analysis exposing disparities in placements; produced evidence that secured 700-800 additional supportive housing units.

earlierWork.name: NYC Mayor's Office of Operations
earlierWork.summary: Product lead for StreetSmart and HOME-STAT dashboards; embedded user-centered design into Homeless Services IT.

earlierWork.name: IDNYC (Human Resources Administration)
earlierWork.summary: Designed executive reporting for Human Resources Administration, the Mayor's Office, and City Council.

earlierWork.name: Ontodia
earlierWork.summary: Designed UX for NYCpedia and CivicDashboards; developed geospatial databases.

education.institution: NYU Tisch School of the Arts

publications.name: NYC Agency and Governance Organizations Lunch and Learn
Using ChatGPT to Explore NYC Open Data
